get.description: The `/auth/nonce` endpoint generates a unique `nonce` that serves as a one-time challenge for the user. This nonce is used during the authentication process, requiring the user to `sign` it with their `private key` to prove their identity.

200.description: Returns the generated nonce as a one-time challenge for the user to sign during authentication.

status.description: An enum representing the possible outcomes of the endpoint, indicating whether the request was successful.

result.description: The generated nonce provided to the user as a one-time challenge for signing during authentication.

500.description: Internal Server Error. The server failed to process the request.

status.description: An enum representing the possible outcomes of the `/auth/nonce` endpoint, indicating whether the nonce generation was successful.

error.description: Indicates that the server encountered an error and failed to generate the nonce.
